duties_responsibilities.duty: Conduct hands-on experience with structure-property relationship studies of materials, advanced imaging technologies, chemical/biological characterization, solvent extraction, chromatographic separation, spectral interpretation, and structural elucidation.
Independently develop new analytical methods, designs, and executes complex, non-standard laboratory studies to solve technical challenges and provide scientific solutions.
Thoroughly and clearly document experiments and prepare high-quality Technical Documents.

Interact with lens designers, contact lens metrology leads, Clinical Project leads, and Vision/Data Scientists. Conduct lab work, data organization, and studies. Prepare and modify formulations, lens fabrication, and characterization.
Search literature, design & conduct experiments to test ideas. Discuss and write technical reports, present results.

education_certification.credential: Enrolled in an accredited university or college for at least one semester prior to the internship, pursuing at least a Bachelors level degree in Chemistry, Polymer Chemistry, Analytical Chemistry, Organic Chemistry, Materials Science, Chemical Engineering, Biochemistry, Biology, Biotechnology, Process Engineering, Ocular Cell Biology, or related major.
